alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; Southern Livingston; St. James; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ascension, northeastern St. James, West Baton Rouge, southern Pointe Coupee, southern Livingston, northern Iberville and southwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 245 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brusly, or near Port Allen, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Plaquemine, Port Allen, New Roads, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Addis, Brusly, Livonia, Sorrento, French Settlement, Maringouin, Fordoche, Rosedale, Port Vincent, Grosse Tete and Morganza. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 134 and 190. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; Southern Livingston; St. James; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
